titles.title: Continuing Appropriation (twelfth)
Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 1996, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 386 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 165 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for the consideration of the joint resolution in the House. Upon adoption of this resolution, the requirement for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House shall be waived with respect to any resolution reported from that committee before April 1, 1996, and providing for consideration of a bill making a general appropriations; a further continuing resolution; or a bill or resolution increasing or waiving the debt limit. Bill is closed to amendments.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 386.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 165 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for the consideration of the joint resolution in the House. Upon adoption of this resolution, the requirement for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House shall be waived with respect to any resolution reported from that committee before April 1, 1996, and providing for consideration of a bill making a general appropriations; a further continuing resolution; or a bill or resolution increasing or waiving the debt limit. Bill is closed to amendments.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 386, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the joint resolution.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Mr. Obey moved to recommit with instructions to Appropriations.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with ten minutes of debate on the motion to recommit.
The previous question on the motion to recommit with instructions was ordered without objection.
On motion to recommit with instructions Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 192 - 230 (Roll no. 82).

vote.text: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 244 - 180 (Roll no. 83).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/20/1996--Introduced. Amends: (1) the Balanced Budget Downpayment Act, I (Pub.L. 104-99) to extend the March 22 appropriations deadline provisions to March 29; and (2) Pub.L. 104-92 to extend the March 22 appropriations deadline provisions to April 3.
